page.title: 12FARMING GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: Farming in this area is very similar on all the farms. The same crops are grown in varying amounts on all the farms, which are mostly arable. It is not dairy farming country. The farmers also fatten store cattle for market as well as growing crops. Some of the farmers also run sheep on their grazing land. A few pigs are also kept, and there is a chicken farm on one of the arable farms. This all takes place within the fertile valley of the River Tees. There are two family owned and worked Market Gardens which cover 57 acres between them, 4 of those under glass, growing salad crops. The smaller of the two provides solely for two stalls in the nearby Darlington covered Market whilst the other produces for wholesale distribution.
